`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CThere I object,\u201D said Filby. \u201COf course a solid body may exist. All
real things\u2014\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:55,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:["\u201CSo most people think. But wait a moment. Can an ",(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:"instantaneous"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:58,columnNumber:50},this),` cube
exist?\u201D`]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:58,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CDon\u2019t follow you,\u201D said Filby."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:61,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CCan a cube that does not last for any time at all, have a real
existence?\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:63,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[`Filby became pensive. \u201CClearly,\u201D the Time Traveller proceeded, \u201Cany
real body must have extension in `,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:"four"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:67,columnNumber:34},this),` directions: it must have
Length, Breadth, Thickness, and\u2014Duration. But through a natural
infirmity of the flesh, which I will explain to you in a moment, we
incline to overlook this fact. There are really four dimensions, three
which we call the three planes of Space, and a fourth, Time. There is,
however, a tendency to draw an unreal distinction between the former
three dimensions and the latter, because it happens that our
consciousness moves intermittently in one direction along the latter
from the beginning to the end of our lives.\u201D`]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:66,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CThat,\u201D said a very young man, making spasmodic efforts to relight his
cigar over the lamp; \u201Cthat . . . very clear indeed.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:77,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[`\u201CNow, it is very remarkable that this is so extensively overlooked,\u201D
continued the Time Traveller, with a slight accession of cheerfulness.
\u201CReally this is what is meant by the Fourth Dimension, though some
people who talk about the Fourth Dimension do not know they mean it. It
is only another way of looking at Time. `,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:`There is no difference between
Time and any of the three dimensions of Space except that our
consciousness moves along it`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:84,columnNumber:41},this),`. But some foolish people have got hold of
the wrong side of that idea. You have all heard what they have to say
about this Fourth Dimension?\u201D`]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:80,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:["\u201C",(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:"I"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:90,columnNumber:2},this)," have not,\u201D said the Provincial Mayor."]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:90,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[`\u201CIt is simply this. That Space, as our mathematicians have it, is
spoken of as having three dimensions, which one may call Length,
Breadth, and Thickness, and is always definable by reference to three
planes, each at right angles to the others. But some philosophical
people have been asking why `,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:"three"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:96,columnNumber:29},this),` dimensions particularly\u2014why not
another direction at right angles to the other three?\u2014and have even
tried to construct a Four-Dimensional geometry. Professor Simon Newcomb
was expounding this to the New York Mathematical Society only a month
or so ago. You know how on a flat surface, which has only two
dimensions, we can represent a figure of a three-dimensional solid, and
similarly they think that by models of three dimensions they could
represent one of four\u2014if they could master the perspective of the
thing. See?\u201D`]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:92,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CI think so,\u201D murmured the Provincial Mayor; and, knitting his brows,
he lapsed into an introspective state, his lips moving as one who
repeats mystic words. \u201CYes, I think I see it now,\u201D he said after some
time, brightening in a quite transitory manner.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:106,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CWell, I do not mind telling you I have been at work upon this geometry
of Four Dimensions for some time. Some of my results are curious. For
instance, here is a portrait of a man at eight years old, another at
fifteen, another at seventeen, another at twenty-three, and so on. All
these are evidently sections, as it were, Three-Dimensional
representations of his Four-Dimensioned being, which is a fixed and
unalterable thing.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:111,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CScientific people,\u201D proceeded the Time Traveller, after the pause
required for the proper assimilation of this, \u201Cknow very well that Time
is only a kind of Space. Here is a popular scientific diagram, a
weather record. This line I trace with my finger shows the movement of
the barometer. Yesterday it was so high, yesterday night it fell, then
this morning it rose again, and so gently upward to here. Surely the
mercury did not trace this line in any of the dimensions of Space
generally recognised? But certainly it traced such a line, and that
line, therefore, we must conclude, was along the Time-Dimension.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:119,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CBut,\u201D said the Medical Man, staring hard at a coal in the fire, \u201Cif
Time is really only a fourth dimension of Space, why is it, and why has
it always been, regarded as something different? And why cannot we move
in Time as we move about in the other dimensions of Space?\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:129,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`The Time Traveller smiled. \u201CAre you so sure we can move freely in
Space? Right and left we can go, backward and forward freely enough,
and men always have done so. I admit we move freely in two dimensions.
But how about up and down? Gravitation limits us there.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:134,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CNot exactly,\u201D said the Medical Man. \u201CThere are balloons.\u201D"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:139,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CBut before the balloons, save for spasmodic jumping and the
inequalities of the surface, man had no freedom of vertical movement.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:141,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CStill they could move a little up and down,\u201D said the Medical Man."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:144,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CEasier, far easier down than up.\u201D"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:146,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CAnd you cannot move at all in Time, you cannot get away from the
present moment.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:148,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[`\u201CMy dear sir, that is just where you are wrong. That is just where the
whole world has gone wrong. We are always getting away from the present
moment. Our mental existences, which are immaterial and have no
dimensions, are passing along the Time-Dimension with a uniform
velocity from the cradle to the grave. Just as we should travel `,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:"down"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:155,columnNumber:65},this),`
if we began our existence fifty miles above the earth\u2019s surface.\u201D`]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:151,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[`\u201CBut the great difficulty is this,\u201D interrupted the Psychologist. \u2019You
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:"can"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:159,columnNumber:1},this),` move about in all directions of Space, but you cannot move about
in Time.\u201D`]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:158,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CThat is the germ of my great discovery. But you are wrong to say that
we cannot move about in Time. For instance, if I am recalling an
incident very vividly I go back to the instant of its occurrence: I
become absent-minded, as you say. I jump back for a moment. Of course
we have no means of staying back for any length of Time, any more than
a savage or an animal has of staying six feet above the ground. But a
civilised man is better off than the savage in this respect. He can go
up against gravitation in a balloon, and why should he not hope that
ultimately he may be able to stop or accelerate his drift along the
Time-Dimension, or even turn about and travel the other way?\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:162,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:["\u201COh, ",(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:"this"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:173,columnNumber:6},this),",\u201D began Filby, \u201Cis all\u2014\u201D"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:173,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CWhy not?\u201D said the Time Traveller."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:175,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CIt\u2019s against reason,\u201D said Filby."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:177,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CWhat reason?\u201D said the Time Traveller."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:179,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CYou can show black is white by argument,\u201D said Filby, \u201Cbut you will
never convince me.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:181,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CPossibly not,\u201D said the Time Traveller. \u201CBut now you begin to see the
object of my investigations into the geometry of Four Dimensions. Long
ago I had a vague inkling of a machine\u2014\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:184,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CTo travel through Time!\u201D exclaimed the Very Young Man."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:188,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CThat shall travel indifferently in any direction of Space and Time, as
the driver determines.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:190,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Filby contented himself with laughter."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:193,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CBut I have experimental verification,\u201D said the Time Traveller."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:195,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CIt would be remarkably convenient for the historian,\u201D the Psychologist
suggested. \u201COne might travel back and verify the accepted account of
the Battle of Hastings, for instance!\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:197,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CDon\u2019t you think you would attract attention?\u201D said the Medical Man.
\u201COur ancestors had no great tolerance for anachronisms.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:201,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201COne might get one\u2019s Greek from the very lips of Homer and Plato,\u201D the
Very Young Man thought.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:204,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CIn which case they would certainly plough you for the Little-go. The
German scholars have improved Greek so much.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:207,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CThen there is the future,\u201D said the Very Young Man. \u201CJust think! One
might invest all one\u2019s money, leave it to accumulate at interest, and
hurry on ahead!\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:210,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CTo discover a society,\u201D said I, \u201Cerected on a strictly communistic
basis.\u201D`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:214,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201COf all the wild extravagant theories!\u201D began the Psychologist."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:217,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CYes, so it seemed to me, and so I never talked of it until\u2014\u201D"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:219,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:["\u201CExperimental verification!\u201D cried I. \u201CYou are going to verify ",(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.em,{children:"that"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:221,columnNumber:64},this),"?\u201D"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:221,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"\u201CThe experiment!\u201D cried Filby, who was getting brain-weary."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\MSI\\Desktop\\personal projects\\starter-blog\\blogs\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d60f9711-3daa-4242-983d-ff02a0b9e37b.mdx",lineNumber:223,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`\u201CLet\u2019s see your experiment anyhow,\u201D said the Psychologist, \u201Cthough it\u2019s

`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:`The Time Traveller smiled round at us. Then, still smiling faintly, and
